primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a New Covenant by sovereignly transforming the human heart from a state of rebellion/paralysis to a state of spontaneous obedience.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will make a new covenant
I will put my law within them
I will write it upon their hearts
God has come with the key to our prison doors

object.identificatie: The New Covenant / The Transformed Heart (Obedience of Faith)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s will and our will is one and the same

ontvanger.identificatie: The House of Israel / The Hearers (The 'Hapless Human Creature')
tekstueel_bewijs: I will be their God, and they shall be my people
Dear people of God and heirs of the Covenant
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the prisoner being set free).

tekstueel_bewijs: written in our hearts by the Holy Spirit
In Jesus... the New Covenant is fulfilled
The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Himself).
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that recreates the will.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / The Paralysis of the Will / The Law (as an external demand)
tekstueel_bewijs: the incapacity of the unaided human being
Sin, finding opportunity in the commandment
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that uses the Law to kill the subject, creating a 'shipwreck' that only divine intervention can fix.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of the believer (exemplified by the two women) acting out of the new heart.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (empowered by God)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a fruit or 'gift' of the primary program (soteriology).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → God (in Christ) ← Sin/Paralyzed Will
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → Writing the Law on the Heart

God writes it on our hearts
He is working through his judgment to recreate our wills
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the child never thought of putting beans in his ears
we must wrestle with the discrepancy

what God wants us to be

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (power) and the divine endowment of it. It moves from 'Devoir' (Law) to 'Non-Pouvoir' (Sin) to 'Pouvoir-Gratie' (Grace).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (the lure of the forbidden) to S2 (the shipwreck/exile), rejects ~S2 (God does not soften the law), and finds resolution in S1 (God writes the law internally).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between Law and Sin is resolved not by abolishing Law, but by God internalizing it in the Subject.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'shipwreck' and 'exile' are treated as ontological realities, not just bad feelings.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human problem as a paralysis of the will that cannot be cured by effort, only by a sovereign act of God.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the two stories
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: These two women were women of prayer. They sought God’s will...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole agent of transformation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It has to be done by divine intervention. Something has to work upon us from beyond ourselves.
They did not even know how they had received this power... it was 'not their own doing, but a gift from God'.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The women are used as examples, but the preacher carefully frames their actions as the result of God's work, not their own virtue.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The two women (as models of the New Covenant)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: 'God has given me a forgiving heart.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; the burden of performance is shifted to God's promise.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God is the one who works in us to will and to do).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the Old Testament history, Pauline theology, and contemporary application into a single actantial movement.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'increased ante' of the Sermon on the Mount and the promise of the New Covenant.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Our disobedience becomes his burden to carry... In Jesus... the New Covenant is fulfilled.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the Law could not.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total incapacity; sin is 'in league with the commandment'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. The narrative engine is fueled by God's 'I will' statements.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The balance is appropriate for a Lenten sermon on the New Covenant.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Maintain the emphasis on the 'impossibility' for man to heighten the 'possibility' for God.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Paralysis) is already sufficiently heavy.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids the trap of turning the New Covenant into a new set of rules.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'beans in ears' metaphor; Greimas shows this metaphor functions as the 'Opponent' (the lure of the forbidden).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Jeremiah's context; Greimas shows how the hearer is structurally placed into the same 'Receiver' position as the Babylonian exiles.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'freedom' mentioned is not the absence of Law, but a change in the Subject's competence (from Devoir to Pouvoir).

volledige_subject_lijst: God (makes, puts, writes, forgives, remembers, gives, comes, works)
The people (rebel, break, betray, cast glances)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'beans in ears' illustration not as a moral warning, but as a semiotic marker of the 'Opponent's' power over the human 'Subject'.
